Data.Name: Ready mix concrete-General

Fragments.Description: Assumed ship transport returns laden for purposes not related to the reporting contract and thus  a zero carbon factor is applied.

Data.Name: Ready mix concrete-General - C6/8 (Gen 0, ST1)

Fragments.Description: Carbon factor taken directly from the ICE V3: Concrete > General. Please note that ICE strongly recommend to avoid selecting a 'general' value for concrete. Selecting data for a specific cement content in the concrete type will give much greater accuracy.

Data.Name: Asphalt-General Asphalt

Fragments.Description: Carbon factor taken directly from the ICE V3: Carbon Factors: Steel > Rebar. Please note the carbon factor is based on world average steel. If the recycled content is known, you may consult the ICE database to identify a more accurate value to enter as a custom carbon factor.

Data.Name: Asphalt-Warm Mix Asphalt

Fragments.Description: Carbon factor taken directly from the ICE V3: Asphalt > Bitumen binder content ranges from 3% to 7%. Value of 5.5% used here as a typical content.

Data.Name: Fill, aggregate and sand-Site-won

Fragments.Description: Carbon factor estimated to be 5% lower than the general asphalt value. If you have a carbon factor for a specific warm asphalt product please add a customer carbon factor and provide supporting information in the notes section of carbon tool. The carbon tool guidance provides further information on custom factors and notes.

Data.Name: Fill, aggregate and sand-General mixture

Fragments.Description: Embodied carbon of site won material assumed to be zero. Emissions from the movement around the site captured by fuel use.
